benchmark_details.name: PLAT
benchmark_details.overview: PLAT is a new benchmark designed to assess the ability of LLMs to predict the legitimacy of additional tax penalties, constructed to evaluate LLMs’ understanding of tax law, particularly in complex cases requiring more than just statute application.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate LLMs’ capability in understanding tax law concerning the legitimacy of additional tax penalties.

data.source: Derived from 50 questions based on Korean precedents related to additional tax penalties.

methodology.calculation: F1 Score is computed as 2*(Precision*Recall)/(Precision + Recall).
methodology.interpretation: High F1 Score indicates better performance of LLMs in predicting tax penalty legitimacy.
methodology.baseline_results: The strongest commercial model achieved an F1 score of 75%.
methodology.validation: Evaluated using six LLMs across various cases.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: CC BY-NC license will be used for the dataset release.
